website_summaries.verdict: This sterile wash helps clear up old stains and prevents new ones, too. Also praised for cleaning eye crust and preventing bacteria growth.
pros: Good for cleaning eyes, removing existing tear stains and slowing new ones from forming
This ophthalmic formula both helps clean debris from eyes and creates conditions where germs and bacteria can't grow using boric acid
cons: The formula tends to gush out, thanks to bottle design
Consider applying with a washcloth to prevent product loss

customer_reviews.title: It works, it just takes time.
customer_reviews.text: When we adopted our Maltese a couple of months ago, he had watery and crusty eyes. It was so bad that he couldn’t open his eyes completely. I had tried different products until I came across this one. At first, I didn’t see much progress, but I kept on applying the Nutri-Vet Eye Rinse every day. Slowly, but surely, his eyes were improving. Four months into the treatment I compared before and after photos and realized he had improved dramatically. I strongly recommend this eye rinse; I still use it just to keep his eyes free of debris.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Castano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent eye wash; highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My Shiu Tzu has boogery crusty drainage. About twice a week I pour a few drops in his eyes then put some on a cotton round to wipe his crusty eyes. Before using this I just used a warm moist washcloth & it was difficult to get them clean. This dissolves the crust & cleans quicker. Af first he doesn’t like it but once it’s in his eyes I notice he feels better & calms down & let’s me wipe his eyes off. Very good, highly recommend. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: OmaT

customer_reviews.title: It's a miracle
customer_reviews.text: My dog had his right eye closed for two days, with green stuff coming out. Reading online what it could be, taking him to the vet was going to be super expensive, they mention X-rays, blood work, and all this stuff that cost hundreds... I bought this hoping it would work because I definitely can't afford $500 in a vet. Let me tell you, after three days his eye was normal again. It was a miracle, I felt like crying. I felt so sorry for him, even thought of giving him up since I couldn't afford to stop his suffering. I'm so happy with this product, my prayers were answered..
customer_reviews.author: Real critic

customer_reviews.title: Burns eyes and not sterile
customer_reviews.text: I strongly suggest doggy parents try this in their own eyes. It burns. My veterinary opthamoligist recommended using human grade eye rinse. Not to mention this isn’t sanitary or sterile. The cap is exposed to everything and not covered. The liquid passes through that cap... My dog has had thousands of eye drops in her life, and this is the only one that makes her flinch.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Essential for tear stains
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog you need this, it's not an overnight miracle treatment but if used everyday it will remove existing tear stains and prevent them!
customer_reviews.author: sydney king

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL soothing to my cats eyes!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to make a boric acid eyewash which lasts without preservatives. This is great to clean my cats eyes because she has a chronic infection called feline herpes virus. It's not contagious to humans or dogs butt hurts the same as peoples herpes. Oral medicine is helping but she still has drainage and it needs wet soaked paper towel or wiping it will make it bleed. Thanks Nutri vet! BTW I got the 2pack accidentally but I'm glad
customer_reviews.author: Mahvelous1

customer_reviews.title: DON"T USE
customer_reviews.text: About a month after using my dog went blind. Even took her to Michigan State Animal Hospital and they were stumped as to why she'd go blind that fast. DON"T USE
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: keeps dog eyes clear
customer_reviews.text: Repeat customer. My cocker is 12 years old and has problems with draining eyes, if I don't keep it under control it turns into an infection. This daily eye wash keeps this under control. Very affordable, easy and affective.
customer_reviews.author: Katie1554

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for use on my Maltese's tear stains. I read a vet's recommendation to use boric acid like what is in contact solution to help with the stains. I was a bit afraid to use contact lens solution, so I found this product had boric acid in it and it was for dog's eyes. I have used it nightly with my poochy and the stains have lightened up A LOT. They have not gone away...but that's ok...I did not expect them to totally go away. After I rinse the stains with this, I add a drop to each of his eyes and it seems to help a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Allergy & Windy Season - Cabinet Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product to get rid of those stubborn stains even after a bath. Just be sure those cute faces are dry before applying just to eye out just how much you’re adding. Always worked for my morkie & silky terrier. Also, it seems to help tone down the tears for my two pups.. well Kunia -my silky terrier is 4, but she’s still my baby.. & Buddy, he's one years old. P.s. if you notice a difference, always keep in mind that you can tone down on from every day use. It’s a pretty good product on medicating the eye.. Atleast for the breeds I have.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Our 12 year old yellow lab experienced facial paralysis for ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 year old yellow lab experienced facial paralysis for a few months last year. It left him with a permanent dry eye condition, because he cannot completely close his eyelids. If "Mr. Squinty Eyes" just sees the bottle, his tail starts wagging. Yep, there's a treat attached to our routine. (^_*) Most importantly, there is a huge difference in his eyes before we started using this product and now.
customer_reviews.author: The Bobber

customer_reviews.title: It did not work for my puppy...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the head is hard to use for me. My puppy got very scared..I will not recommend. The worst part is-this product is not eligible for return, even if it is defective or with prime membership. I don't think this is reasonable so I want to point this out in my review.
customer_reviews.author: Teddi

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for this.
customer_reviews.text: My dog (chihuahua) had cherry eyes or at least what I thought was they beginning of cherry eyes. It hurt when I would try to clean her eyes. She cried every time I would try to touch her. I felt so stressed trying to book a vet appointment and they were booked two weeks out. I bought this thinking it might not work, after a few days of constant application her swelling went down. She stopped crying when I wiped around her eye area. The redness reduced surprisingly fast. This stuff works miracles!! I apply this every other day now just as an eye rinse.
customer_reviews.author: Stephany Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not very much improvement, but some improvement is better than none. The first photo is about a week from using the product, second photo is before using it. The third photo is to show the size of the 4oz bottle.
customer_reviews.author: AshleySpears

customer_reviews.title: eye rinse for eye stain and smell
customer_reviews.text: my dogs eyes drain a lot, he is a white dog most white dogs have this problem and eye staining and it leaves a smell on his face from it and washing his face daily helps with water and a cloth but using the eye rinse daily which helps keep bacteria away which is were the smell comes from really helps and keeps him from getting an infection under eye area. I would say use daily if you have a white dog for sure works great.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Eh, not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: I have a chihuahua who has some small tear discoloration so I decided to try this product. I’ve used it for about 5 days and maybe see a small difference. So if a dog has a big discharge problem this might work. Some advice - don’t peel off the whole silver foil from the bottle; instead poke a hole in the foil so that it actually drips out of the tube. I removed the entire foil and when I open the tube top, it pours out into my dog’s eyes, which she hates.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Only used it for two days and it WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been having excessive tearing and boogies coming from (only one) of his eyes because of the Fall seasonal changes. This came in the mail yesterday and between yesterday and today I already see a huge difference. I might only have to use it for another day or two before it clears up the issue. Notably, I did put way too much yesterday because the full bottle does have some lack of control spillage upon initial use.
customer_reviews.author: Isah

customer_reviews.title: First package the seal was partially opened & I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: First package the seal was partially opened & I thought the product was tampered with so I got another one shipped out. The second one was leaking upon arrival.. and the silver seal on that bottle was stuck to the stop of the cap.. I'm not sure if the seal of supposed to be secure/glued on or if it's just supposed to act as a sealant..? No instructions to further explain and do not feel completely safe using this on my dog until I know more :(
customer_reviews.author: GNOWA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a shih Tzu and his eyes get irritated from his allergies. Also he has HUGE eyeballs so it’s easy for him to have trash in his eye. I didn’t want to spend a lot on eye drops from the vet so I got this product instead and so far so good. It does the job, I don’t have any issue with the nozzle, and great price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So effective my Corgi doesn't struggle when I apply it
customer_reviews.text: Corgis are particularly susceptible to eye infections from irritants. It seems that every couple of weeks my pup starts to tear incessantly from one eye. That's when I pull out this rinse which usually clears up the issue immediately. I'm the beginning he would run away and struggle while we tried to rinse his eye. Now he will sit patiently till we are done because he knows the discomfort will stop. I highly recommend you keep a bottle around.
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Soothing drops for allergy eyes.
customer_reviews.text: Despite some of the unfavorable reviews here, I decided to give these drops a try. My little dog suffered from terrible allergies. Along with Vet prescribed meds, these drop really seems to soothe her itchy eyes. Additionally, I did consult my Veterinarian about using this product. I shower her the ingredient list and the suggested use. She was fine with this product.
customer_reviews.author: SusanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great for Allergies and Dry Eyes in Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog has severe allergies and with the medication she takes her eyes get very "goopy". Since they are so dry from the medication and irritated from the allergies it is hard to get the "goop" out. I purchased this eye rinse to help loosen up the debris in her eyes so that I could wipe it away with a tissue. This product did just that. It is non irritating so she isn't running the other way when I bring it out. I put a few drops in each eye then wipe with the tissue as it gets the debris out. Great product for allergies and dry eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca AnneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Bassets seasonal allergies eye fix
customer_reviews.text: rx drops, liquid tears and purified water soaks all did nothing ...read some excellent vet info on this type of product that is boric acid, they recommend 3x daily for human and animal with NY EYE ISSUE...WITHING 2 DAYS MY BASSET WAY BETTER. NOW IF HE ONLY COULD NOT BE ALLERGIC TO POLLEN
customer_reviews.author: michelle~

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cleaning Tear Stains
customer_reviews.text: This arrived next day, sealed, & in perfect condition. My puppy’s left eye gets tear stained. A few days after starting daily use of this product I noticed quite a difference. I use it on soft gauze to clean my pup’s face. It works much better than wipes I have for cleaning tear stains. I recommend & will re-order.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: dog doesn’t mind
customer_reviews.text: we have a Bichon and he always has red stains around his eyes. this does seem to work somewhat.. it’s not like magic.. but it reduces the redness and my dog doesn’t mind the formula itself. he doesn’t run when he sees with coming with this, lol and he has no qualms letting us know when he’s uncomfortable. he just sits there and lets me run it into the red stains. not sure if i would buy again.. but we’ll see. maybe it helps if you use it consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Works to soften eye gunk to make it easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this before. At first I was totally satisfied because it works well to soften the eye gunk so I can remove it. My dog hates when I use it. Now after a couple of years of use, I notice that the area near the eyes where I use this have turned white. I think this product might have bleached the color, but I'm not sure because she is an older dog and has some grey hair so I don't know if the white is from aging or from using this.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada City CA

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 1/2 year old German Shepherd with allergies. His eyes have looked dry around the edges lately so I got him these eye drops to see if it would help. I give him a few drops once a day and his eyes definitely look a lot healthier now. He no longer has the crud buildup in the corners of his eyes. I would imagine that a bottle of this size will last a long time and since it expires in 2 years, that shouldn’t be a problem. I highly recommend these eye drops for your pooch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I use it on my dogs eyes (pug and boxer). They don't have any problems but I like to flush their eyes on a daily basis. It seems to help with the eye boogers, especially in my boxer. I always wait for this to hit the $3-$4 mark. The one thing I will say is that it can be difficult to dispense, especially in the beginning. It would leak all over the place. Over the years, I've gotten better at predicting the flow but I wasted a lot of product in the initial phase.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Blinking
customer_reviews.text: My dog was blinking a lot after having too much fun, you know (she is a Boston so her eyes are kind of evident). So I put 3 drops (maybe one I was able to put in the right place, she was a little bit wiggling) ever 2/3 hours for just 3 times and she was completely fine after that.
customer_reviews.author: Pri

customer_reviews.title: Great for Maltese tear stains!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Maltese dogs that have horrible tear stains. I started using this product to help with them. Luckily they are easy to use and my boys don’t mind it them too much. There is no scent and they don’t seem to sting or both their eyes. I have seen some improvement with the tear stains. Hoping to see more with continued use. I have been using it every night.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Super clean (no chemicals) eye wash!
customer_reviews.text: My sweet Bella kitty, at 5 yrs. old, suddenly started having brown crust in one eye. I wiped it off a couple of days with drinking water & a paper towel. That made her eye a little red! She doesn't do well with any chemicals, but I didn't want to chance mixing my own salt water for her (kitties are so small!). After looking at every products ingredients, I found this to be the most pure salt solution. I just pour a little on a paper towel (don't use a washcloth bc trace detergent can remain in them), wipe the outside of her eye, & the yucky brown stuff has stopped after a week!
customer_reviews.author: Penelope P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product with terrible delivery
customer_reviews.text: The product works well. It helps clean the eye and surrounding area. The problem is the dropper cap, impossible to get a couple of drops out, so you have nothing but a mess. Additionally the dog hates it because the get a bunch of fluid in their eyes so they won't hold still. The top is so bad I am actually going to buy a container with proper dropper. Solution 5 stars, container 1.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Will Buy This Again!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has severe dry eyes. He ran out of the prescription eye drops from vet. They “had to be ordered and might be here in a week or so”.. I bought these drops (delivery 2 days). I believe they are working better than the prescription!! His eyes look better after just 2 applications! You do have to watch the adjustable top on the bottle though. I sprayed eye solution over his head the first attempt. I just screwed the lid a little more and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Rippe

customer_reviews.title: Just what my Yorkie needed
customer_reviews.text: I use this product every morning when I groom my 5 lb Yorkie. I put it on a piece of cotton and then drop some in both of her eyes by squeezing the cotton. I then comb her hair near her eyes with a special comb. She tolerates it well. It keeps her eyes clear all day.
customer_reviews.author: bjbinfl

customer_reviews.title: It works; be patient!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely is reducing tear duct stains on my white malti-poo. I feel good this is a safe product I can use long term if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: The eye rinse works amazingly! Our little morkie gets eye boogers and we're constantly trying to clean it or carefully cut it away. I used this rinse with some cotton balls and it broke up the crusty eye boogs quickly and she didn't mind at all! There was no scent and it didn't sting our dog and she was all cleaned up within a few minutes. I highly recommend it! It's perfect and comes at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Heather De Metro

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say enough how great this product is
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough how great this product is. Our cocker spaniel doesn't love when we put them in, but tolerates them well so doesn't seem to sting (just makes him confused and shake his head for a sec). It has helped his streaming eyes so much. He used to have contact green gunk in his eyes before we started using this. Now it's only on occasion, and the gunk is lighter in color. I don't know the medical term, but looks cleaner haha. His eyes don't produce it as much in general, and his eyes look less red and irritated. Love it. So great!
customer_reviews.author: Singingafterdark

customer_reviews.title: Does you dog have cloudy eyes, then buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: My boxer has cloudy/gooey eyes and I was using Vetericyn Plus Antimicrobial Pet Ophthalmic Gel which didn’t seem to work good. It would work for that moment but the next day was the same or sometimes worst. So I decided to try this product and OMG I was so happy I made a right choice. Once I’ve put some on her eye it instantly washed away and the next day her eye was clear. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for any of my 7 dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I Dk how this product had a high rating. Didn’t work on my dogs tear statins at all. Used for a month w/no results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, affordable, tried and true !
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that this product arrived fairly quickly. My boston terrier had been having eye discharge for about a week before I realized she must need some sort or eye solution. After just 1 use I can see a difference. I used it twice the same day and by the 3rd day no more discharge. I use it periodically every couple of days now just to keep her eyes clean. But no complaints here. Works like magic. Not the easiest to apply but once my dog realized it wasnt so bad it became a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Will not use
customer_reviews.text: I put one drop and my poor dog was having issues. A minute after applying she was rubbing her eye and wouldn’t stop. I finally flushed it with plain water and she was fine. Not sure what happened but won’t use it again.
customer_reviews.author: MSC

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but my dog doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: After running in the bushes and leaves my dog gets a lot of dirt in his eyes and sometimes it triggers infections. If applied right after a walk in the forest his eyes look much better. My dog doesn't share my point of view though. I don't know if it is this particular lotion or just any lotion, but my dog starts hiding whenever he sees the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This rinses my dogs eyes out with no problem. My dog plays in the yard and rolls in the dirt and we have to clean her eyes out and this rinse if great for the money. Will pruchase aain
customer_reviews.author: JAY

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates this  :(
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was the bottle that my dog didn’t like. So I cleaned out an eye dropper and filled it with the eye rinse. The dropper made it easier, but she still would barely let me put one drop in both eyes. I tried it again with the original bottle. I can get some in one eye, but she refuses to hold still or even runs from me when I try to get some in her other eye.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: It works and my dog is more comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old shihtzu 14 years old. He's deaf and mostly blind. He is definitely nearing end of his life. His eyes recently have gotten really murky and produced lots of fluid. This has cleared his eyes and he seems to like that I'm using it. He seems more comfortable. I don't want to stress him out with any unnecessary doctors visits. I'm very happy!😁
customer_reviews.author: PhilsFan

customer_reviews.title: Great help to clean doggie eyes mucus
customer_reviews.text: Very good product helped very much my doggie !! Try not to touch anything with the tip to avoid contamination. Great product for a great price, was my experience, purchase it twice... recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JORGE Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Really like the twist applicator at at the top of the bottle. You can control the amount coming out at a time. Two. three drops etc. depending in the type of dog and the issue your having. This product reduced the eye goobers on my worst two dogs by 85%. Put in their eyes once a week to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Works to clean eye
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product every month for the past year. I use it everyday. It has prevented my dog from getting a recurring infection that he suffered prior to beginning using it.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Unscented, Doesn't Sting, Helps my Dog's Eyes
customer_reviews.text: I love these drops. I've purchased several bottles in the past. No scent, clear and watery - not thick like some drops. Consistently good. I use them in my Shihtzu's eyes several times a week. Helps with the redness and they don't seem to mind getting the drops put in. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: LongTimeAmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Rinse worked well.
customer_reviews.text: My bull terrier has chronic eye mucus, they have narrow eye slots and it's pretty much the norm...This rinse did it's job at flushing it out... My dogs don't seem to like it, as expected, but it doesn't seem to irritate them. I almost gave up on this, but after a few weeks my dogs eye mucus has diminished to a quarter of what it usually is.
customer_reviews.author: F. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, at least for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Shih Tzu’s. They had watery eyes and a little tear staining. But this eye solution has worked wonderfully. One drop in their eyes every morning after I’ve cleaned them. At one point I stopped doing it for awhile, and my male ended up with a sty. So back to everyday. I would suggest to not to squeeze the bottle because too much comes out. Instead open nozzle and softly shake 1 drop in each eye after you’ve cleaned them.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great rinse for your dog's eyes
customer_reviews.text: No one likes putting things in their eyes unless they have to and dogs are the same (haha). I take my dog to the dogpark pretty much everyday and a lot of things go into her eye so when we come home I always rinse out her eyes. This rinse has been pretty good and no problems with it. She doesn't like it but as long as her eyes remain clean and clear then I'm good :)
customer_reviews.author: MarleeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, clean eyes!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great eye rinse for my beach dog! Given that my puppy has huge eyes, likes to play in the sand at the beach, and even plays in the water at the shore, her eyes can get pretty irritated. This eye rinse appears to give her some relief, although she's a bit apprehensive about things being squirted in her eye. I don't blame her for that. I notice that she rubs her eyes much less after she's had a few drops.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dry eye
customer_reviews.text: My dog suddenly got a very red irritated eye so I bought this product. She ended up needing antibiotic eye drops but if your dog suffers from dry itchy eyes i would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: No more tear stains
customer_reviews.text: HUGE difference!!! Tear stains are almost gone from 1 week of using 1x a day. She also doesn't rub her eyes anymore. Maltese puppy
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well to flush and treat eyes
customer_reviews.text: My little dog has terrible eye alergies. I use this on him every day to flush out his eyes. I soak a cotton ball to flush and wipe out debris. It must be pleasant for him because he doesn't have any negative reactions. He's very peaceful every time I apply it.
customer_reviews.author: ReindeerGames

customer_reviews.title: Great for Allergies - Fast and Effective
customer_reviews.text: My border collie mix suffers from allergies in the spring and fall. I give him allergy pills which helps, but he inevitably gets an eye infection also. I thought I'd try this eye rinse this fall, and it arrived the day before our vet appointment for what looked like the beginning of an eye infection. I immediately rinsed his eyes with this, and did it again 4 hours later. By morning, the eyes were cleared up and I cancelled the vet appointment. This stuff is great! Saved me a vet bill and also eliminated the need for antibiotics. I use this at the first sign of redness now, and my baby no longer scratches his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Great preventative option!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy got a bit of conjunctivitis and had to have EXPENSIVE steroid drops from the vet. We purchased this bottle as a maintenance option and have been so pleased! For 3 bucks and change, we've been using the same bottle for about 3 months now and haven't seen any more eye infections for our pup. We also love that it helps clear her eyes a bit after we go hiking or walking in grass. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EGoodrichTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Priced well but needs better application bottle
customer_reviews.text: The product is good but the bottle opening is not fine enough. The opening is large and the product gets wasted when trying to put it in my dogs eyes. I now put it on a different cloth and wipe his eyes and am looking for a single drop bottle.
customer_reviews.author: lg212

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. Exact ingredients as saline solution you can purchase saline solution for a couple bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Dog

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Works great in removing gunks around my dog's eyes. Let it sit for little bit before cleaning so it comes off easily without pulling on their hair. If only using to clean their eyes for sand or pieces of hair that gets stuck in their eyes, put couple drops and wipe. Comes out great. Def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Starian

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was playing in the backyard and got something in his eye. He was barely able to open his eye and it was red/swollen .We have been putting these drops every 2hrs for the past couple of days and his eye is looking better.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Good eye rinse
customer_reviews.text: I use this eye wash at the end of every single bath that I give my dog. I don't know if soap gets in her eyes or not, so this makes sure it gets washed out if it's there. Sometimes she has small hairs or lint in her eyes, so this washes it out as well. She doesn't mind this because she knows her bath is almost finished!
customer_reviews.author: HappyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't prevent eye stains on MY dog!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for a small white terrier mix. He has the dark eye stains and dry nose. I am hoping that this product at the least relieves discomfort. As far as preventing eye stains? Nope! Looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: simonshops

customer_reviews.title: works to rinse nut not for tear stains
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clear up the tear stain on my dog's eyes however it didn't do that but i did rinse things out of his eyes when he went outside and got something in it. it works well for that but I have used peroxide for his tear stains and if clearing up
customer_reviews.author: kenya m. johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This product is part of my dog's medical kit that I keep at home and when we travel. Dust, weeds, and pollen irritates my dog's eyes when he's out working on the farm so I always keep this product on hand.
customer_reviews.author: MagSam

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for my girl and the next day her eye started to cleared up after a week of suffering (Allergies and boogies) I don’t put it directly in her eye, instead I soak a cotton ball with it and gently swipe/dab it across her eye. Great price also.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not-so-good packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but the bottle isn't the best, in my opinion. I have a small yorkie though, so maybe it would work better for larger dogs with much larger eyes. When I attempt to squeeze a drop into my sweet little pup's eye, WAY too much liquid comes out of the bottle and it freaks us both out. I'm going to use it up, but I wish the bottle tip was tweaked a little to limit the amount of fluid released with each squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up dog's pink eye
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in hopes that'd it help clear up my dog's pink eye (the boric acid is supposed to help fight eye infections) and it's worked like a charm so far! I've been using it for about 3 days and his eyes are almost completely back to normal! Good to use if you're in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Can't Believe How Fasts This Works
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie has dry eyes and I've been giving him what three of my vets have recommended, however none of their prescription medicine or the regular drops have given better results than these eye drops. His eyes are not red and he's stop pawing at them. I am so happy I came across these eye drops. What a life saver! I am going to also let my vet know about these amazing eye drops
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effectively Cleans
customer_reviews.text: I love this eye rinse and so does my puppy! My corgi puppy often gets her sleepy crust in her eyes--the parts that I don't have to chance to wipe off her face first. The drops don't irritate her eyes, and they clean her eyes well. The bottle also a convenient tip for easy application.
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My poor dog had some pus in her eyes that would stick together and she could barely open her eye. I started giving her these eye drops, and it cleared right up and now she's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: My dog won’t sit still for this. It also kind of squirts like a water gun. I tried it for my Maltese’s brown tear stains for a few weeks but didn’t notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Perez

customer_reviews.title: Good for after rough play in the dirt
customer_reviews.text: Good preventative. My dog got a horrible eye infection from dirt and debris at the dog park. We now use this right after he plays and his eyes are crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ribbin E.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! Gentle rinse for my Pug!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a while now and it works very well. I have a Pug and his eyes need to be rinsed at least twice a day. This product does a gentle, really good job. Pug eye boogers are huge and stringy. They flow right out of his eyes. I can easily highly recommend this rinse! Non irritating for him.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: It works well, painless, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Our scottie has some kind of icky eye allergy and has had it for years. This stuff make cleaning out her eye very easy and apparently, not painful or uncomfortable. One bottle lasts months and the bottle is pretty good and controlling how much liquid it dispenses. I just bought a second bottle, but haven't needed to open it yet. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn ArmstrongTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Dry eyes
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a severe dry eye problem. I use it 3 times a day. It does help her so she doesn’t have to take her paw to rub her eyes other wise her eyes are itching & she can hardly see out of them. Also it helps to get all the junk out of her eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works
customer_reviews.text: After >$600 at the vet with minimal results I decided to give this a try. Within 2 weeks my dogs overall eye health has gone from 20% to 70%, no exaggeration. Previously, my bullmastiff’s eye was rarely fully open and his eye was constantly discharging. Now his eye is always fully open and discharge has reduced significantly. Not only that, but the health of his eye ball also appears much improved and less irritated as well. This stuff works!!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Cotter

customer_reviews.title: purchased for donation to military canine Christmas Stocking event for ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased for donation to military canine Christmas Stocking event for pack/ship early December to overseas units. Packaging as received was secure for sort/pack/ship by December 3rd, 2016.
customer_reviews.author: happy2share

customer_reviews.title: Works for us.
customer_reviews.text: My little one hates to get his eyes cleaned but they always are messy because of his allergies and bad air. He doesn't mind this wash too much, so I can clean his eyes when they need it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Works to remove gunk and eye stains from poodle/bichon mix
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES his eye treatments, and actually looks forward to them. Works to remove gunk from eyes and most of the eye staining. We also switched to a different dog food and only use filtered water for drinking water. The combination has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money I'm about to order another one. My dog suffers from dry eye so mucus and gunk type stuff gets crusty and clouds her eye. This stuff is GREAT for breaking it up and making it easier to clean her eyes. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Good eye wash
customer_reviews.text: It's a liquid and easy to use. My dogs yes is always gunky and this washes it so it is easy to wipe off. It doesn't hurt him
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Wasted half the bottle just trying to get it to come out right and I still can’t get it. From what I’ve managed to get on my dogs eye, it hasn’t done anything.
customer_reviews.author: Leona

customer_reviews.title: Great Eye Rinse for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Eye issues can be a real problem for dogs. And it's that time of year when seemingly everyone is experiencing eye issues, including pets.That's where these drops come in. They address several eye issues that face dogs very well. The Nutri-Vet eye rinse is great for reducing irritation and redness. It is also helps keep eyes clean. It also helps reduce tear stains. It can also fight infection, which is a huge plus. The bottle is 4 oz. You only need a few drops in each eye. It comes with a dropper spout that makes it easy to administer the eye rinse.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duramonov

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our dog with allergies
customer_reviews.text: I love this eye rinse for my dog. My Cavalier King Charles Spaniel has weep eyes and has allergies so I like to use this rinse at least once every other day to rinse out any debris in his eyes. Sometimes when he does have full blown allergies it looks like borderline eye infection and I use this rinse on his a couple times a day and it clears it right up! I highly recommend this eye rinse and will definitely continue purchasing this product in the future. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: BeerMazon

customer_reviews.title: Great product what a big difference
customer_reviews.text: These drops really work and helped tremendously with my dog’s tear stains and overall eye health. It does take about a week for long term results but it’s worth the wait. Don’t hesitate to try this. I only gave four stars because I want to wait and see if there are any negative results that may arise.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Blue

customer_reviews.title: Eye wash for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, baby (my pup) doesn’t seem to mind. Better or just as good as the $45 I just spent at Vet for a prescription
customer_reviews.author: Baby Ree

customer_reviews.title: ... gone from what I thought was normal to looking like they're glistening
customer_reviews.text: In just a few days my dog's eyes have gone from what I thought was normal to looking like they're glistening. Any redness, tearing or irritation is completely gone. Truly a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Angee

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: My dogs eye was itchy and seemed really red as it was going away I gave him some drops and he almost immediately stopped with the scratching of the eye, there was a bit of head shaking around but after a couple seconds nothing after a few hours the eye seemed to lose the redness
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Only product that’s has worked effectively for my pup. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha A.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to sting eyes
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates to get this in her eyes, but does not mind if I use it underneath to clean up debris and stains. I believe it must sting.
customer_reviews.author: Wary

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. I feel like the percentage of the boric acid could be higher because that’s the antiinflamatory agent.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Beware: I got "EAR WASH" not eye wash from this seller. I saw this happened to others
customer_reviews.text: My bottle says "Ear Wash" on it. Don't buy here. Get something better. This is not the answer. Smells terrible too.
customer_reviews.author: gimpy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, keeps the eye boogers at bay
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, keeps the eye boogers at bay. Price doubled like within a week or two (albeit now it's about the same price as retail) approx. $4 to $8. It's definitely good for flushing out the dog's eye, basically the same way we use eye drops (to keep our eyes clean and hydrated). But I doubt I'll continue to keep myself stocked. You don't get much for $8 a bottle. $2/oz in a 4 oz. bottle of saline solution? Glad I bought it when they were cheaper but when I run out I'll probably make my own or just use warm filtered water to wipe away debris from dog's eye.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Works so much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better than I expected! I wasn't so sure if this product was the right one for me because it was through personal searching and not through a vet's direct help, but it definitely helped clear the severe redness in my dog's eyes in even just the first day after use (and helps clear out that excess mucus that leaks out of his eye). My dog also seems to itch his eyes a lot less now too. I have been using it for a few months now and am running a little dry so I will most definitely be buying from here again.
customer_reviews.author: Wonja Kim

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: My dog has chronic dry eyes and I have to clean his eyes pretty often. This seems to soften the crustiness around his eyes and make it easy to get off
customer_reviews.author: Hannah's

customer_reviews.title: Helps irritated eyes quickly
customer_reviews.text: We have a Pom who doesn't fully close her eyes when she sleeps. She's always had eye issues as a result. This product breaks up the crusty stuff and helps ease the inflammation. Once a week or so I soak cotton balls with this and hold them gently to her eyes for several minutes. The difference is visually noticeable..
customer_reviews.author: Ann Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good product does not burn
customer_reviews.text: Does the work perfectly. It doesn’t burn in the eye. The dog is much better even though I think they don’t apply it everyday. No scent
customer_reviews.author: Leli

customer_reviews.title: Worked great-avoided vet bill!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has green boogery goops in one eye for a few days that seemed to be getting worse. Rather than pay for a vet bill we ordered this. I used it twice a day for about a week and the goop went away for the most part, and then I kept using it once a day and the little infection has since gone away completely. It’s hard to trust random products like this for dog health, but it worked for us!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Wing
